content:
Phishing Risk Analysis

Our analysis of the URL http://192.168.1.1/login.php has determined a very high phishing risk score of 100. This indicates a strong likelihood that this URL is associated with a phishing attempt. We strongly advise against interacting with this website.

Key Risk Indicators

Several technical indicators contribute to this high-risk assessment:

    • IP Address as Hostname: The use of an IP address (192.168.1.1) instead of a registered domain name is highly suspicious. Legitimate websites, especially those requesting login credentials, almost always use domain names. IP addresses are typically used for internal networks or server administration, not public-facing login pages. This suggests a potential attempt to obscure the website's true identity.
      • Unencrypted Connection (HTTP): The URL uses HTTP instead of HTTPS. HTTPS encrypts communication between your browser and the website, protecting sensitive information like usernames and passwords. The absence of HTTPS makes any data you submit vulnerable to interception by malicious actors.
        • Generic Login Page Filename: The use of a generic filename like "login.php" is common in phishing attacks. While legitimate sites may also use this convention, combined with the other risk factors, it strengthens the suspicion of phishing.

      Technical Assessment

      The URL http://192.168.1.1/login.php points to a web server using a private IP address. This address range (192.168.1.1) is reserved for local networks and is not accessible directly from the public internet. This suggests the phishing attempt might be originating from within a local network or attempting to mimic a local network resource. The lack of a domain name and the use of HTTP further increase the risk, as it prevents verification of the website's identity and leaves any submitted data exposed.

      What This Means For You

      Interacting with this website could lead to severe security risks. If you submit your login credentials on this page, they could be stolen by attackers. This could compromise your accounts, leading to identity theft, financial loss, or other harmful consequences. This IP address being internal also raises the possibility of a targeted attack within a specific network.

      Recommended Actions

        • Do not click on this link: Avoid accessing this URL under any circumstances.
          • Do not enter any information: If you accidentally land on this page, do not enter any login credentials, personal details, or financial information.
            • Report the phishing attempt: If you received this link in a suspicious email or message, report it to the appropriate authorities (e.g., your IT department, email provider, or anti-phishing organizations).
              • Verify website authenticity: Always double-check the URL and look for HTTPS before entering sensitive information on any website.
